text.title: Follow Singaporean Food Etiquette
text.head: Follow Singaporean Food Etiquette
text.p: Singapore is dubbed the " Food Paradise " by people all over the world . Many delicacies and good food from all over the world can be found in Singapore . Here we will show two common yet unique ways of eating non-local food and more conventional foods in Singapore , using your hand and chopsticks .
text.head: Steps
Indian and Muslim food ( hand )
text.p: Indian and Muslim food like nasi briyani , roti prata , nasi lemak and nasi padang are usually consumed using the hand by the locals . They are taught to use their right hand only when taking the food .

list.item: Use your thumb , index finger and middle finger to grasp the food . Only your fingers should come in contact with the food .

Keep hand contact to the food to the minimal .
The thumb of the hand is used to " push " or " guide " the food into your mouth .

When consuming roti prata , you should tear the prata with one hand only . Using your thumb and index finger , tear a piece of the prata off , and then scoop the curry or the vegetables , with the bread and then eat .
It is incorrect , and inelegant to eat the curry and the bread separately .

text.head: Chinese food ( chopsticks )
text.p: Chopsticks are naturally believed to have originated in the olden days of China . The traditional eating tools are a pair of small identical , even-length tapered sticks .

list.item:
Put one chopstick between the palm and the base of the thumb
, using the ring finger ( the fourth finger ) to support the lower part of the stick . With the thumb , grip the stick down while the ring finger pushes it up . The stick should be steady and very stable .

Use the edge of the thumb
, index and middle fingers to sustain the other stick like a pen . Make sure the tips of the two sticks line up .

Balance the upper stick up and down
towards the stationary lower stick . With this oscillation one can pick up food of any amazing sizes !

With plenty of
practice
, the two sticks will serve like a pair of tongs .

text.head: Tips

list.item: Chopsticks generally should be held at the thicker end about one-third along their length for balance and accuracy . For greater touch to pick up food further away , hold the chopsticks at the upper ends .

If the tips fail to its position , it will be difficult to hold things . Hold the chopsticks upright with one of the tips lightly touching the table , and gently push the chopsticks down or gently loosen your grip for a moment to let both tips become equal in length . You can also alter your grip or holding position this way .
With practice , it is likely to perform step one and two according on lifting up the chopsticks with one hand . Adjust your grip if possible .
